verses.roman:
ei saba līlā kare śacīra nandana
anya loka nāhi jāne vinā bhakta-gaṇa

synonyms: ei saba—all these; līlā—pastimes; kare—performed; śacīra—of mother Śacī; nandana—son; anya loka—other people; nāhi—do not; jāne—know; vinā—except; bhakta-gaṇa—the devotees.
translation: These are confidential pastimes of the son of Śacī. Other than devotees, no one knows of this incident.

purport.content: Nondevotees cannot believe this incident, yet the place where the tree grew still exists in Māyāpur. It is called Āmra-ghaṭṭa or Āma-ghāṭā.
